main_definition: Meetings refer to gatherings of individuals or groups to discuss, exchange information, make decisions, plan activities, or simply interact.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Formal gatherings for discussion and decision-making
meanings_and_examples.example: The board held a weekly meeting to review the company's progress.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Regular scheduled meetings, often within an organization or group
meanings_and_examples.example: Our team has monthly meetings every first Thursday of the month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Informal social gatherings to catch up and interact with others
meanings_and_examples.example: Sarah invited her friends for a casual get-together at her house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Meetups or networking events where individuals with similar interests come together
meanings_and_examples.example: John attended a coding meetup to network with other software developers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Synchronization of tasks and activities among team members
meanings_and_examples.example: The project manager scheduled daily check-in meetings for all team members to ensure synchronization of work.
